1.title: 1. What is Ethical Hacking
1.description: Learn the concept of ethical hacking and its basic principles

pages.title: What is Ethical Hacking?
pages.content: Ethical hacking is the legal and ethical hacking activities conducted to identify security vulnerabilities in systems and enhance security. Ethical hackers help protect systems by learning the techniques used by malicious attackers.

pages.title: Purpose of Ethical Hacking
pages.content: The main purpose of ethical hacking is to proactively identify security vulnerabilities in systems and close these vulnerabilities. This way, security measures can be taken before real attackers can harm the systems.

pages.title: Ethical Hacking Process
pages.content: The ethical hacking process consists of the following stages: Planning and Authorization, Reconnaissance and Information Gathering, Vulnerability Analysis, Penetration Testing, Reporting and Recommendations.

pages.title: Quiz: Ethical Hacking Basics
pages.question: What is the main purpose of ethical hacking?
pages.explanation: The main purpose of ethical hacking is to proactively identify security vulnerabilities in systems and close these vulnerabilities.

1.title: 2. Types of Hacking
1.description: Learn different types of hacking and their characteristics

pages.title: Types of Hacking
pages.content: Hacking is divided into various types according to different purposes and motivations. Each type has its own unique characteristics and risks.

pages.title: Black Hat Hacking
pages.content: Black hat hackers cause damage by gaining unauthorized access to systems. This type of hacking is illegal and is done with malicious intent. It includes activities such as data theft, system shutdown, and financial damage.

pages.title: White Hat Hacking
pages.content: White hat hackers are security experts who perform ethical hacking. They work with legal permissions to test system security. They help protect systems by identifying security vulnerabilities.

pages.title: Gray Hat Hacking
pages.content: Gray hat hackers sometimes engage in legal and sometimes illegal activities. They may gain unauthorized access to systems but generally do not intend to cause harm. When they find security vulnerabilities, they report them to system administrators.

pages.title: Quiz: Types of Hacking
pages.question: Which type of hacking is illegal?
pages.explanation: Black hat hacking is illegal and is done with malicious intent. It includes activities such as damaging systems and stealing data.

1.title: 3. Types of Hackers
1.description: Identify different types of hackers and their characteristics

pages.title: Types of Hackers
pages.content: Hackers are divided into different categories according to their motivations, skills, and goals. Each type has its own unique characteristics and behavior patterns.

pages.title: Script Kiddie
pages.content: Script kiddies are people who perform hacking using ready-made tools and scripts. They do not have deep technical knowledge and usually engage in activities for entertainment purposes. They may organize attacks to gain fame on social media.

pages.title: Professional Hacker
pages.content: Professional hackers are experts with high technical skills. They work in security companies, government agencies, or independently. They perform ethical hacking, penetration testing, and security research.

pages.title: Quiz: Types of Hackers
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Quiz: Types of Hackers]
pages.question: What is the characteristic of script kiddies?
pages.explanation: Script kiddies perform hacking using ready-made tools and scripts. They do not have deep technical knowledge.

1.title: 4. Advantages and Disadvantages of Hacking
1.description: Analyze the positive and negative aspects of hacking

pages.title: Advantages of Hacking
pages.content: Ethical hacking increases system security, identifies vulnerabilities, and protects organizations. It helps security experts develop their skills and offers career opportunities in the cybersecurity field.

pages.title: Disadvantages of Hacking
pages.content: Malicious hacking damages systems, causes data loss, and leads to legal problems. It can result in theft of personal information, financial losses, and reputation damage.

pages.title: Ethical Rules
pages.content: When performing ethical hacking, legal permissions must be obtained, privacy rules must be followed, and there should be no intent to cause harm. All activities must be transparent and accountable.

pages.title: Quiz: Advantages and Disadvantages of Hacking
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Quiz: Advantages and Disadvantages of Hacking]
pages.question: What is the most important advantage of ethical hacking?
pages.explanation: The most important advantage of ethical hacking is to increase security by identifying vulnerabilities in systems.

1.title: 5. Test Preparation
1.description: Comprehensive test for Introduction to Ethical Hacking category

pages.title: Test Preparation
pages.content: This test covers all topics in the Introduction to Ethical Hacking category. Review the topics you have learned before the test and start the test when you are ready.

pages.title: Test Rules
pages.content: The test consists of 10 questions. There is only one correct answer for each question. After completing the test, you can see your results and review the topics you missed.

pages.title: Category Completion
pages.content: When you successfully complete this test, you will have completed the Introduction to Ethical Hacking category. Your test result should be 70% or above.

pages.title: Comprehensive Test: Introduction to Ethical Hacking
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Comprehensive Test: Introduction to Ethical Hacking]
pages.question: What is the first stage of the ethical hacking process?
pages.explanation: The first stage of the ethical hacking process is planning and authorization. No security testing can be performed without legal permissions.

1.title: 6. Famous Ethical Hacking Events in History
1.description: Learn about famous ethical hacking events in history and their impacts

pages.title: Famous Ethical Hacking Events in History
pages.content: Throughout history, many important ethical hacking events have occurred. These events have contributed to the development of the cybersecurity field and the establishment of security standards. In this lesson, we will examine the most important ethical hacking events.

pages.title: Kevin Mitnick - The Most Famous Hacker
pages.content: Kevin Mitnick was the world's most wanted hacker in the 1990s. He was able to make free calls by hacking phone systems. After being caught in 1995, he completed his sentence and specialized in ethical hacking. Today he works as a security consultant.

pages.title: Anonymous - Hacktivist Group
pages.content: Anonymous is a hacktivist group founded in 2003. It works to support WikiLeaks, protest censorship, and fight for social justice. It has organized attacks against major companies like Sony, MasterCard, and Visa. The group has opened up the debate about the line between ethical hacking and hacktivism.

pages.title: Stuxnet - Cyber Weapon
pages.content: Stuxnet was a cyber weapon that targeted Iran's nuclear facilities in 2010. It went down in history as the first malware to target industrial control systems. This event demonstrated the reality of cyber warfare and the security vulnerabilities of critical infrastructure.

pages.title: WannaCry - Global Attack
pages.content: In 2017, the WannaCry ransomware attack affected more than 300,000 computers in over 150 countries. Many institutions, including the NHS (British Health System), were affected. This attack demonstrated the importance of security updates and the value of ethical hackers.

pages.title: Quiz: Famous Hacking Events in History
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Quiz: Famous Hacking Events in History]
pages.question: Which event is known as the first cyber weapon to target industrial control systems?
pages.explanation: Stuxnet went down in history in 2010 as the first cyber weapon to target Iran's nuclear facilities and affect industrial control systems.

pages.title: Question 2: Types of Hacking
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 2: Types of Hacking]
pages.question: Which type of hacking is legally and ethically accepted?
pages.explanation: White hat hacking is a type of ethical hacking performed with legal permissions. It works by obtaining legal authorization for security tests.

pages.title: Question 3: Types of Hackers
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 3: Types of Hackers]
pages.question: What is the basic characteristic of script kiddies?
pages.explanation: Script kiddies perform hacking using ready-made tools and scripts. They do not have deep technical knowledge.

pages.title: Question 4: Ethical Rules
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 4: Ethical Rules]
pages.question: What is the most important rule when performing ethical hacking?
pages.explanation: The most important rule when performing ethical hacking is to obtain legal permissions. Performing unauthorized security testing is illegal.

pages.title: Question 5: Historical Events
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 5: Historical Events]
pages.question: Which event is known as the first cyber weapon to target industrial control systems?
pages.explanation: Stuxnet went down in history in 2010 as the first cyber weapon to target Iran's nuclear facilities and affect industrial control systems.

pages.title: Question 6: Ethical Hacker Responsibilities
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 6: Ethical Hacker Responsibilities]
pages.question: What is the basic duty of an ethical hacker?
pages.explanation: The basic duty of an ethical hacker is to protect systems. They make systems secure by identifying security vulnerabilities.

pages.title: Question 7: Hacking Advantages
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 7: Hacking Advantages]
pages.question: What is the biggest advantage of ethical hacking?
pages.explanation: The biggest advantage of ethical hacking is to increase system security. It protects systems by identifying security vulnerabilities.

pages.title: Question 8: Professional Development
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 8: Professional Development]
pages.question: Why should ethical hackers continuously develop themselves?

options.text: Because the cybersecurity field is constantly changing

pages.explanation: Because the cybersecurity field is constantly changing, ethical hackers must stay current. New threats and techniques are constantly emerging.

pages.title: Question 9: Kevin Mitnick
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 9: Kevin Mitnick]
pages.question: What does Kevin Mitnick do today?

options.text: He works as a security consultant

pages.explanation: After completing his sentence, Kevin Mitnick specialized in ethical hacking and today works as a security consultant.

pages.title: Question 10: WannaCry
pages.content: [Quiz Page: Question 10: WannaCry]
pages.question: In which year did the WannaCry attack occur?
pages.explanation: The WannaCry ransomware attack occurred in 2017 and affected more than 300,000 computers in over 150 countries.

2.title: 1. Web Application Security Fundamentals
2.description: Learn the basics of web application security and common vulnerabilities

pages.title: Web Application Security Overview
pages.content: Web application security is the process of protecting websites and web applications from various security threats. It involves identifying, preventing, and responding to security vulnerabilities in web applications.

pages.title: Common Web Vulnerabilities
pages.content: The most common web vulnerabilities include SQL Injection, Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF), and Insecure Direct Object References. Understanding these vulnerabilities is crucial for web security.

pages.title: OWASP Top 10
pages.content: The OWASP Top 10 is a standard awareness document for developers and web application security. It represents a broad consensus about the most critical security risks to web applications.

pages.title: Security Testing Methods
pages.content: Web application security testing includes static analysis, dynamic analysis, penetration testing, and code review. Each method has its own advantages and should be used in combination.

pages.title: Secure Development Lifecycle
pages.content: Integrating security into the software development lifecycle helps prevent vulnerabilities from being introduced into applications. This includes security requirements, secure coding practices, and regular security testing.

pages.title: Quiz: Web Security Fundamentals
pages.question: What does OWASP stand for?
pages.explanation: OWASP stands for Open Web Application Security Project, a nonprofit foundation that works to improve software security.

3.title: 1. Network Security Fundamentals
3.description: Learn the basics of network security and protection mechanisms

pages.title: Network Security Overview
pages.content: Network security involves the policies and practices adopted to prevent and monitor unauthorized access, misuse, modification, or denial of a computer network and network-accessible resources.

pages.title: Network Security Threats
pages.content: Common network security threats include malware, phishing, DDoS attacks, man-in-the-middle attacks, and unauthorized access. Understanding these threats is essential for effective network protection.

pages.title: Firewall Configuration
pages.content: Firewalls are network security devices that monitor and control incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules. Proper firewall configuration is crucial for network protection.

pages.title: Intrusion Detection Systems
pages.content: Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) monitor network traffic for suspicious activity and issue alerts when such activity is discovered. They are essential for detecting potential security breaches.

pages.title: Quiz: Network Security Basics
pages.question: What is the primary purpose of a firewall?

options.text: To monitor and control network traffic

pages.explanation: The primary purpose of a firewall is to monitor and control incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.
